name: places/ChIJ83qEpx1ZwokR6cCi4Wqqgn8

displayName.text: Turkish Consulate General in New York

adrFormatAddress: 821 1st Ave., New York, NY 10017, USA

originalText.text: Went with my dad today for several procedures. The staff was very friendly and extremely helpful. Both of us were able to complete everything and get our questions answered. It was such a relief because government papers and procedures can get confusing and lengthy, but the staff helped through everything. One thing I learned from my experience is that it will be easier for everyone to bring cash for transactions and at least 2 or more identical photos (if you happen to forget though there is a shoe store around the corner that does them for $10)

originalText.text: The staff at the Turkish Consulate in NYC are the epitome of professionalism. Right from the entrance, you're met with a warm welcome. The employees are notably well-educated and assist with utmost respect and professionalism. Moreover, the architectural design of the consulate is impressive and worthy of admiration. The combination of outstanding service and a visually appealing environment contributes to a remarkably positive experience.

text.text: The staff at the Turkish Consulate in NYC are the epitome of professionalism. Right from the entrance, you're met with a warm welcome. The employees are notably well-educated and assist with utmost respect and professionalism. Moreover, the architectural design of the consulate is impressive and worthy of admiration. The combination of outstanding service and a visually appealing environment contributes to a remarkably positive experience.

originalText.text: Praying I never have to come here again. Our appointment was for 11:15 a.m. we arrived at 10:55 a.m. and checked in. I had a ticket and my parents had their own separate ticket only one number after mine. We sat and waited for 1 hour and 20 minutes until we were finally called, only to be told we had to fill out a paper form before being able to complete registration. NOTE that every single person that was being called up were being turned away because they TOO did not have this form filled out- you would think after the second person that they should have an announcement about this, nope, nothing, its like they like to watch people waste their time. ANYWAY, after filling the appropriate forms we had to wait once again- I was called and completed my registration however my parents were not although they were one number after me. The workers skipped their number 14+ times until we were fed up and said something, the workers scrambled a bit and called us up only to scolded my parents for not doing their registration with me when I had gone up earlier- I'm sorry then what are tickets for ???? We had separate appointment times and we were trying to do things the proper way but I should have realized. In total we spent from 10:55 a.m. - 12:45 p.m literally waiting around for our turns. Waste of all our time. Ridiculous to say the least.

originalText.text: I had an exceptional experience at the Turkish Embassy and Turkish House in New York. The location is superb, providing convenient access. The services offered were truly wonderful, showcasing the warm hospitality of Turkish culture. I highly recommend it for anyone seeking a positive and enriching cultural experience.

originalText.text:
Fast and effective consulate services!
Friendly staff!
Top notch receptions!
Excellent consul general. He works really hard for the betterment of the Turkish community.
